de.awi.floenavigation.deployment

Class StationInstallFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • de.awi.floenavigation.deployment.StationInstallFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class StationInstallFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener
    This Fragment runs on top of the DeploymentActivity and shows the layout for deployment of a Static Station or a Fixed Station depending on the value of DeploymentActivity.aisDeployment. The Layout for deployment of Fixed Station shows an extra MMSI field whereas if a Static Station is being deployed the MMSI field is hidden and the tablet's Latitude and Longitude are shown.
    See Also:
    BroadcastReceiver, DeploymentActivity, Runnable

        private int numOfSignificantFigures
        Sets the number of significant figures to show after a decimal point on the screen. This does not affect the calculations. The value is read from DatabaseHelper.decimal_number_significant_figures

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Default Fragment.onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle). Checks the type of station being deployed by reading the arguments passed to it from DeploymentActivity. If the Fixed Station is being deployed it shows the MMSI field and hides the Tablet's latitude and longitude field If a Static Station is being deployed it hides the MMSI field, shows the Tablet's latitude and longitude and reads the DatabaseHelper.configParametersTable to set numOfSignificantFigures and changeFormat.
        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        inflater -
        container -
        savedInstanceState -
        Returns:

      • onClick

        public void onClick(android.view.View v)
        Default Handler for the Confirm button on the Screen. It checks the Station type being deployed and calls the specific function for the deployment of that type.
        Specified by:
        onClick in interface android.view.View.OnClickListener
        Parameters:
        v -

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Called when Fragment is no longer in foreground. It unregisters the AIS and GPS BroadcastReceivers.
        Overrides:
        onPause in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public void onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu menu,
                                android.view.MenuInflater inflater)
        Creates the Action Bar icons on top of the screen. For a static station deployment it shows the Option Menu of Changing Lat/Long View format. By default it shows the GPS icon, AIS Connectivity icon and the Grid Setup icon.
        Overrides:
        onCreateOptionsMenu in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        menu -
        inflater -

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem menuItem)
        Default handler for the Action Bar Option Menu of Change Lat/Lon View format. Only called when a Static Station is deployed. It inverts the value of changeFormat and updates its value in DatabaseHelper.configParametersTable so that the same format is shown throughout the App.
        Overrides:
        onOptionsItemSelected in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        menuItem -
        Returns:

      • actionBarUpdatesFunction

        private void actionBarUpdatesFunction()
        Registers and implements the BroadcastReceivers for the AIS Connectivity and GPS location broadcasts; which are sent from NetworkMonitor and GPS_Service respectively. The GPS Broadcast receiver sets the value of locationStatus, tabletLat and tabletLon to the values from the GPS_Service. The AIS Connectivity broadcast receiver sets the boolean packetStatus. This also registers Runnable which runs at a regular interval specified by ActionBarActivity.UPDATE_TIME and it checks the booleans locationStatus and packetStatus and changes the Action Bar icons for GPS and AIS Connectivity accrodingly.
        See Also:
        Runnable, Handler, BroadcastReceiver, ActionBarActivity

      • populateTabLocation

        private void populateTabLocation()
        Reads the values of tabletLat and tabletLon and populates it on the Screen formatting the coordinates according as specified by changeFormat. Uses the NavigationFunctions.locationInDegrees(double, double) to convert the format of the coordinates.
        See Also:
        NavigationFunctions.locationInDegrees(double, double), String.format(String, Object...)

      • validateMMSINumber

        private boolean validateMMSINumber(android.widget.EditText mmsi)
        Parameters:
        mmsi - the EditText for the MMSI field on the Layout
        Returns:
        true if the MMSI field is not empty, contains only digits and has a valid length (specified by VALID_MMSI_LENGTH)

      • insertAISStation

        private void insertAISStation()
        Inserts a Fixed Station MMSI in the Database tables DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and DatabaseHelper.stationListTable. Only inserts the Fixed Station if the MMSI and Station name are valid. Before inserting in the Database tables it checks if the Station already exists as a Mobile Station or is already in the Fixed Station Deleted tables. If the MMSI being added is a mobile station it removes from the Database table DatabaseHelper.mobileStationTable and then inserts the name and MMSI of the Fixed Station to the Database tables DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and DatabaseHelper.stationListTable. It replaces the current fragment with AISStationCoordinateFragment to calculate and insert the parameters such as angle Alpha and x, y coordinates of the station. It passes the MMSI number of the Fixed Station to AISStationCoordinateFragment.
        See Also:
        AISStationCoordinateFragment, DatabaseHelper, ContentValues

      • insertStaticStation

        private void insertStaticStation()
        Checks the validity of the Station Name of the station and if the current tablet location is available. Checks if the Station already exists if so it shows a Toast message to that effect. Otherwise it replaces the current fragment with StaticStationFragment to insert the static station in the Database. It passes the current tablet location and the station name and type to StaticStationFragment.
        See Also:
        StaticStationFragment, DatabaseHelper, ContentValues, Toast

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Called when the Fragment come back from background to foreground. Enables the Up Button and calls the actionBarUpdatesFunction() to set the correct icon colors in the Action Bar.
        Overrides:
        onResume in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • populateStationType

        private void populateStationType(android.view.View v)
        Populates the Spinner with values of Station Type from DatabaseHelper.stationTypes. Static Stations and Fixed Stations both have the same list of Station Types.
        Parameters:
        v -
